p: Cussonia species (Araliaceae) are used in African traditional medicine to treat pain, inflammation, gastro-intestinal disorders, malaria, and sexually transmitted diseases. Methanolic extract of leaves of 13 Cussonia species was tested for in vitro anti-trichomonas activity against T. vaginalis, and MIC was found to be in the range of 0.8–1.3 μg/mL ( De Villiers et al., 2010).
